"In Darkness" is a dramatization of a factual rescue of Jewish refugees during World War II in German-occupied Polish City of Lvov (now is part of Ukraine). For over a year, a Polish sewer maintenance worker and burglar - Leopold Socha - at first along with his friend and coworker - Szczepek WrÃ³blewski - hid and cared for a group of hunted Polish Jews, who had escaped the massacres and deportations during the liquidation of the Ghetto of Lwow. At first helping them in exchange for payment, but then continuing to do, even after the Jews' money had run out also participating that cost, and aiding them had become ever more dangerous.
